Vulnerabilities.Title: Regular Expression Denial of Service in braces
Vulnerabilities.Description:
Versions of `braces` prior to 2.3.1 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS). Untrusted input may cause catastrophic backtracking while matching regular expressions. This can cause the application to be unresponsive leading to Denial of Service.


## Recommendation

Upgrade to version 2.3.1 or higher.

Vulnerabilities.Title: nodejs-cryptiles: Insecure randomness causes the randomDigits() function returns a pseudo-random data string biased to certain digits
Vulnerabilities.Description: Eran Hammer cryptiles version 4.1.1 earlier contains a CWE-331: Insufficient Entropy vulnerability in randomDigits() method that can result in An attacker is more likely to be able to brute force something that was supposed to be random.. This attack appear to be exploitable via Depends upon the calling application.. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 4.1.2.
